column2: Beginning of English for children 2
# form 1 to 6
# fly, flies, flew, flown, flying.

# if something bounces or you bounce it, it moves quickly away form a surface it has just hit or you make it do this.
- The ball bounced twice before he could reach it.
- The ball bounced up and down.

# ( also cherry red ) bright red color.
- Cherry lips.
# noun ( plural: cherries ) a small soft round fruit with shiny red or black shin and large seed inside.
- She asked her little brother. "Because a red berry is a cherry!" her brother said.
# form 6 to 12

# shakes, shook, shaken, shaking. 
- He shook the bottle.

# sits, sat, sat, sitting.
- The baby birds sat in the nest

# a hollow place or structure that a bird makes or chooses for laying its eggs in and sheltering its young.
- To leave the nest. (= leave your parent's home)
# sees, saw, seen, seeing.

# sings, sang, sung, singing.
- Brenda sang a song. She sang a song while she walked to school.

# knows, knew, known, not used in progressive tenses.
- She knew that one and one are two.

# that is it, in the past: that was it.
- She knew that three and three are six. But that was it.

# dries, dried, dried, drying.
- She dries her hand on a clean towel.

# to touch something / somebody several time with your hand flat, especially as a sing of affection. 
- She patted the dog on the head.

# the feeling of liking or loving something / somebody very much and caring about them.
- He did not show his wife any affection.
# caring ( care )
- Children needs lots of love and affection.

# ( in meaning is almost near pat, but has little difference.)
# to touch or move your hand gently over an animal or a child in a kind and loving way.
- The wanted to pet the animals.
# form 13 to 18

# rides, rode, ridden, riding. 
- She rode her horse almost every day.

# holds, held, held, holding.
- She held her nose. She jumped into the water.  She went under the water.

# stands, stood, stood, standing.
- She stood at edge of the pool.

# feels, felt, felt, feeling.
- The water felt so good.

# brings, brought, brought, bringing. 
- Sharon's mother had brought her to the pool.

# buys, bought, bought, buying.
# has no 'r' here.

# noun. A piece of equipment for climbing up and down a wall, the side of a building, etc consisting of two lengths of wood or metal that are joined together by steps or rungs. 
- To climb up / fall off a ladder.
- She swam to the ladder in the pool.
# swims, swam, swum, swimming.

# a message that is written down or printed on a paper and usually put in an envelope and send to someone.
- British : to post a letter.
- American : to mail a letter.
- Lulu wrote a letter to her grandma.

# ( opposite: earlier ( early ) ) used to refer to the second of two things, people, or group that have just been mentioned, or the last in the list.
- The latter half of the year.
- He presented two solution, the latter seems much better.

# at the time in the future; after the time you are talking about.
- See you later.
- I met her again three years later.
- Her father died later that year.
# writes, wrote, written, writing.

# finished or completed.
- When you are down, perhaps I can say something. 
- After writing the letter, Lulu told her mom she was done.
# form 19 to 24

# running or flowing, in the way.
- I can hear the sound of running water.
- A fast-running river.
- Larry has the flu. His nose is running.

# 1. the thick main stem of a tree that the branches grow from
# 2. the space at the back of a car that you put bags, cases, etc in
# 3. long nose of an elephant
# 4. swimming trunk
# 5. a large strong box with a lid need for storing or transporting clothes, etc
# 6. the main part of the human body apart from the head, arms, and legs.
- His new car has four doors. It has a trunk.

# noun. Verb. Adjective. An extra thing that you keep in case you need to replace the one you usually use ( used especially a tire of a car )
- I have lost my key and I have not got a spare.
- It has one trunk. The spare tire is in the trunk.

# the metal part over the front of a vehicle usually covering the engine. 
- His new car has one hood. The engine is under the hood.

# verb, noun. To fasten something or be fastened with a buckle. 
# noun: a piece of metal or plastic used for joining the ends of a belt or fastening a part of a bag, shoe, etc.
- Mark sits in the front seat when he drives his new car. He always buckles his seat belt.
# noun: a long narrow piece of leather, cloth, etc  that you wear around the waist.

# noun: { on pen / bottle / carton / ? } a cover or top for a pen, bottle, carton, etc.
- James took the milk out of the refrigerator. He took the cap off the carton of milk.

# to make a liquid or other substance flow from a container in a continuous stream, especially by holding container at the angle. 
- He poured some milk into the glass. He poured some chocolate syrup into the glass of the milk.

# adjective: not mixed with anything else; with nothing added.
- Pure gold / silk ,etc.

# verb: ( -rr- ) { mix, move in circle way }
# to move a liquid or substance around, using a spoon or something similar, in order to mix it thoroughly. ( thoroughly: completely )
- He stirred the milk with a spoon. He licked the spoon.
# around here: move in a circle way

# noun: the back part of something. 
- There are toilets at the front and rear of the plane.
# adjective: at or near the back of something.
- front and rear window
- He puts air in the rear tire.
- the rear entrance to the building
# verb: to care for young children.
# from 25 to 30

# to have confidence in somebody; to believe that somebody is good, honest, sincere ,etc.
- Trust God.
- She only trust God. She does trust the hospital.

# 3. across a street, an open space ,etc.
- I went over (= across the room) and asked her name.
- After English class she walks over to the pool.
# Academic Word. (formal ) to tell somebody to do something , especially in a formal or official way. Synonym: direct and order.

# someone who teaches a sport or practical skill.
- A driving instructor. 
- Ski instructor. 
# North American: a teacher below the rank of assistant professor at a collage or university. 
- Her coach is her swim instructor.
# Adam's mom said, "Guess what?" We have a new son."

# a person that the Christian Church recognizes as being very holy, because of the way they have lived or died.
# very good, kind or patient person.

# 2. a person who is very good and kind; a child who behaves well.
- At church she was with the saints. She was with the angels. And most of all, she was with God.
beginning of the week
# form 31 to 36

# a piece of clothing like a shirt, worn by women.
- Patty got a doll for Christmas. It is a rag doll. It has a blue blouse.

# greatest degree. 
- At church she was with the saints. She was with the angels. And most of all, Peggy was with God.

# noun. A platform with an open front and a roof, built onto the side of a house on the ground floor. Synonym: veranda in British.
- The porch light shined on the cat.
- Her mom came outside on the porch. She looked at the cat.
# a soft doll made form pieces of cloth

# noun. How much something is worth in money or other goods for which it can be exchanged. 
- To go down / fall / drop in value.

# very useful or important. Opposite: valueless, and worthless. 
- A valuable experience. 
# synonym: invaluable ( = extremely useful )
# synonym: priceless ( = extremely valuable )

# ( opposite: poor ) having a lot of money or property. 
- You can see coins every day. Some coins are valuable. They will make you rich.

# a thing or things that are owned by someone; a possession or possessions. 
# land and building.
# from 37 to 42

# around fruit with soft red and yellow skin, yellow flesh and a large round rough seed inside .
- He gave her a peach another day.

# the soft substance between something skin, and bones of animals or human bodies. 
- The trap had cut deeply into the rabbit's flesh.

# rises, rose, risen, rising.
# { of sun and moon } when the sun and mood ,etc rises, it appears above the horizen.
- the sun rises it the east.

# a large round vegetable with thick orange shin. The seed can be dried and eaten and the soft flesh can be cooked as a vegetable or in sweet pie.
- The moon was like a big pumpkin.

# ( also light bulb ) The glass part the fits into an electric lamp, etc to give light what it is switched on.
- A 60-watt bulb.

# a long gun which you hold up to your shoulder to shoot.
- "What is behind the door?" she asked her mom. Her mom said a rifle was behind the locked door. Daddy kept a rifle in the closet.
# to search a place or container quickly because you are looking for something, especially something to steal.

# ( Especially North American ) a cupboard built into the wall of a room form the floor to the ceiling. 
- A closet full of beautiful clothes.
# ( British: built in / fixed wardrobe and American closet )
# from 43 to 48

# ( British: icing and American: frosting )
# but frosting in British means: the crime of stealing a vehicle that has been left with the engine running in cold weather so that the engine warms up.
# The meaning of frosting as not meaning as front noun or frost verb

# lights, lit, lit, lighting. 
- Her dad lit the four pick candles.

# blows, blew, blown.
- Then she blew out all four pick candles.

# noun. A quantity or thickness of something the  lies over a surface or between surfaces.
- A thin layer of dust covered everything.
- The cake had two layers.

# thinks, thought, thought, thinking.
- He thought and thought.

# a fat gray and white bird with short legs. Pigeons are common in cities and also live in woods and fields where people shoot them for sports or food.
- The sound of pigeons cooing. 
- She liked to feed popcorn to the pigeons.

# ( informal, North American ) to pass solid waste form the bowels. 
- The dog just pooped in the kitchen. 
- A baby drools a lot. It pees a lot. It poops a lot.
# the tube along which food passes after it has been through the stomach, especially the end where waste is collected before it is passed out of the body.
# to be or put yourself in a flat or horizontal position so that you are not standing or sitting.
# lies, (p) lay, (pp) lain, lying.
# to say or write something that you know is not true.
# lies, (p) lied, (pp) lied, lying.
# to put someone or something in a particular position, especially what is done gently or carefully.
# lays, laid, laid, laying.
# cries, cried, cried, crying.
# tries, tried, tried, trying.
# to be or move yourself in a sitting position, rather than lying down or leaning back

# to bend or move from a vertical position. 
- I leaned back in my chair. 
- The tower is leaned dangerously. 
- I man was leaning out of the window.
# form 49 to 54
# ( informal, disapproving ) used especially by children about and to a person who copies what somebody else does because they have no ideas of their own.

# 1. to produce an exact copy of an animal or a plant from its cells.
- Dolly , the cloned sheep.
- Dad said, "Why do not you clone him? They will make a new brand Pirate for you."
# 2. to illegally make an electronic copy of stored information form a person's credit card ?

# 5. a device in a vehicle for making a loud sound as a warning or signal.
- To honk your car horn.
- They honked their horns at each other.

# if a car horn, honks or you honk, or honk the horn, the horn makes a loud noise.
- They used their horn to talk. Honk! Honk!

# a small gun that you can hold and fire with one hand.
- An automatic pistol.
# ( North American ) water pistol, squirt pistol. A toy gun that shoots water
# a small gun that used air pressure to fire small metal balls ( also called pellets )

# verb. To say that you are willing to do something of somebody or give something to somebody.
- He offered some useful advice.
- Don offered it ( the pistol ) to his brother Tony.

# the part of a gun that you press it order to fire it.
- To pull / squeeze the trigger. 
- The pistol has a silver trigger.
- He aimed the pistol at the bird. He pulled the trigger.

# 1. to try or plan to achieve something.
- He has already aimed high. (= tried to achieve a lot )
# 3. to point or direct a weapon, a shot, a kick, etc at someone or something.
- I was aiming at the tree but hit the car by mistake.

# 6 { gun, camera } containing ball, film, etc
- A loading shotgun.
- He said, "If the gun was loaded, I wound have killed the bird."

# adjective. Something that you want to do or achieve very much.
# a strong desire to achieve something. 
- She had always had an ambition to be a pilot.
- I am a happy, lazy dog. "But do not you have any ambition?" asked the fox.
- "Ambition? Ambition to do what? I am just a dog." said the dog.

# a competition in which people try to win something.
# verb: to take part in a competition, election, etc and try to win it.
- He won one piano contest after another.
# form 55 to 60

# ( British: childminder ) to take care of babies or children for short time while their parents are out.
- She regularly babysits for us.
- She babysat them all.
- She kept them in her house all day. She is a bad babysitter.
# babysits, babysat, babysat, babysitting.
# a square or rectangular piece of cloth filled with soft material, used to rest your head on in bed.
# sleeps, slept, slept, sleeping.
# keeps, kept, kept, keeping.

# ( also catalogue in British ) 1. a complete list of items, for example of things that people can look at or buy.
- A mail-order catalog. (= a books showing goods for sale to be sent to people's house )
- Paul opened a catalog. The catalog was full of pictures. It was full of pictures of pets.

# noun. An official system used for sending and delivering letters, packages, etc.
- A mail service / train / truck .
- We will mail it to you. What if I do not like it? Just mail it back.

# { in sport } an action that is against the rules of the game.
- It was a clear foul by Ford on the goalkeeper.
- A foul ball came their way. People dived for the ball.

# 11 { area } an area, a part of a country, etc.
- I think he lives somewhere over Landon way.

# the most excellent thing or person.
# the highest standard that something or someone can reach.
- Mommy will Santa bring me all these dolls? No honey, just pick the one you like best. But Mommy, I like them all the best.

( plural: drawings ) a picture made using a pencil or pen rather than paint.
- He like the comics. He like the drawings.

# a nut that grows underground in a thin shell.
- A pack of salted peanuts.

# a small hard fruit with a very hard shell that grows on some tree.
- To crack a nut ( = open it )
week starting ?
# form 61 to 66

# ( or get into something ) 1. to arrive at a place. 2. to win an election. 
- The train got in late.

# 7.row of people or things. A row of people or things next to each other or behind each other.
-  A long line of trees.
- They drove to the park. They got in line. Many cars were in front of them.
# drives, drove, driven, driving.

# about a group of people or things that each person / thing work,play, etc to another person / thing.
- The squirrels ran up and down the trees. The squirrels chased one another. The squirrels played with one another.
# it is different from 'together' meaning.

# phrasal verb. To sleep until often the time you usually get up in the morning. 
- "We should not have slept in." "I know," said mom.

# earlier, earliest. 
- They should have gotten up earlier.

# a person whose job is to take care of a park, a forest, or an area of countryside. 
# 3. a soldier who is trained to make quick attack  in enemy area. Compare 'commando' 
- "I am sorry," said the park ranger. "We are closed."

# noun. { of area or land } an area of land used for a particular purpose.
- A parking lot. 
- The ranger said the parking lot was full. There is no place to park.

# catches, caught, caught, catching. 
- She never caught one squirrel. She never caught one birds.
# they have the same pronunciation with cough, but have no the same meaning with each other.

# to open something that has been folded, so that covers the large area than before.
- She spread the map onto the floor.
- The spread its wings.
- The body opened a jar of peanut butter. He spread the spread peanut butter onto a slice of bread.

# ( a type of fruit like, apple, banana, peach, cucumber, cherry )
#  a small green of purple fruit that grows in bunches of a climbing plant.
- Wine is made of grapes.
- He opened the refrigerator and took out a jar of grape jelly.
# 3. a type of jar that does not contain any pieces of fruit. ( may be a soft jam or smooth jam )

# teaches, taught, taught, teaching, also teacher.
# idm: you can not teach an old dog new trick. 
- My mom has taught me well. I will do in collage.

# cheer is opposite with boo.
# verb: to shout loudly to show support or praise for someone, or give them encouragement. 
# cheer up / cheer someone up: to become more cheerful.
- Give Mary a call; she needs some cheering up.
- My mom always cheering me up.
# from 67 to 72

# ( sandier, sandiest ) covered with or containing sand.
- A sandy beach.
- Sandy soil.
- This was the first time she saw the sandy beach.

# digs, dug, dug, digging.
- She dug holes in the sand.
- I think I will do some digging in the garden.

# throws, threw, thrown, throwing. 
- She picked up some wet sand. She threw the wet sand.

# bends, bent, bent, bending.
- She bent down. She picked up some wet sand.
# not straight. ( of a person ) not able to stand up straight.

# a natural skill or interest in something.
- She has a bent for mathematics.

# watch ? cover
# let ? stand.

# verb: to cut something into slices.
- Slice the cucumber thinly. 
# noun: a thin flat piece of food that has been cut off a large.
- Cut the meat into thin slices.
- She sliced an apples. She put apples slices on each plate.
# from 73 to 78

# noun. A hollow metal object often shaped like a cup, that makes a ringing sound when hit by a small piece of metal inside it.
- The bird had a bell around its neck.

# rings, rang, rung, ringing.
- The bell rang.

# falls, fell, fallen, falling.
- The bell fell off the bird's neck. It fell next to the baby.

# ( of person ) mentally or physically an adult. Synonym: adult.
- What do you want to be when you are grown-up?
- Ten is a grown-up number. I am an adult now. I am a grown-up.

# something and a half.
- She said she was seven and a half years old.
- two and a half pounds. 2 ?
- One and a half hours are allowed for the exam. 
- The second half of the book is more exciting.
# plural: halves. And also Halve is a verb, than means: to reduce by a half; to make something reduce by a half

# first, second, third, fourth, fifth, sixth, seventh, eighth, ninth, tenth, eleventh, twelve:twelfth,
 thirteen:thirteenth, fourteen:fourteenth, fifteen:fifteenth, sixteen:sixteenth, seventeen:seventeenth,
 eighteen:eighteenth, nineteen:nineteenth, twenty:twenty-th or twentieth, thirty:thirtieth, forty:fortieth,
 Fifty:fiftieth sixty:sixtieth seventy:seventieth eighty:eightieth  ninety:ninetieth

# noun. A light wind.
- a sea breeze. 
- They loved to stick their heads and arms out the windows and feel the breeze.
# verb: to move in a cheerful and confident way in a particular direction. 
- She just breezed in and asked me help.

# verb: (-rr-) to like one thing or person better than other; to choose one thing rather than something else because you like it better ( more )
- Coffee or tea? I would prefer tea, thanks.
- They both preferred the front seat.

# (British: lead)  a dog piece of leather, chain or rope used for holding and controlling a dog.
- All dogs must be kept in a leash in public place.
- Tommy got a dog leash, a plastic bag, and a little plastic shovel.

# a tool with a long handle and a broad blade with curved edges, used for moving earth, snow, sand, etc.
- Workmen with picks and shovel.
# verb: to lift and move earth, stone, coal, etc with a shovel.

# a small, sharp, pointed, part of the stem of some plant, such as roses. 
- Some trees or bushes have thorns. 
- Roses have thorns. His mom said, "Thorns will stick you." Be careful around thorns.

# to continue to be outdoors or away form your house at night.
- I do not like you staying out so late.
# stay out of something: to not become involved in something that does not concern you
- I wish you would stay out of my business.

# to affect someone; to involve someone.
- Do not interfere in what does not concern you.
# synonym: relate , also related ( adjective )
# relate: show or make connecting between two or more things.
# form 79 to 84

# ( for bed: to go to the bed )
- It is time for bed (= it is time to go sleep )
- That night she get ready for bed.

# a place where two or more road, lines, etc meet or cross each other.
- His father always told him to cross at an intersection.

# noun: { make on paper } a mark an object formed by two lines crossing each other. (X and + )
- I have put a cross on the map to show where the hotel is.
# verb: to go across; to pass or stretch form one side to another side.
- I waved and she crossed over. ( = crossed the road towards me )

# adverb: from one side to another side
- it is too wide, we cannot swim across.
# preposition: from one side to the other side of something.
- She walked across the field.
- He walked across the street.

# a part of a road where vehicles must stop to allow people to cross
- He looked at the crosswalk sign.

# means, meant, meant, meaning.
- It was a red hand. The red hand meant Do not Walk. ( traffic light )
# lie      lies     lay      lain     lying     ( put in a flat position )                                                # only verb
# lie      lies     lied     lied     lying     ( to say something that is nut true )                             # verb and noun.
# lay     lays    laid     laid     laying   ( put sth/sb in a particular position gently  or carefully ) # verb, noun, adjective

# verb: to talk quickly and continuously, especially about thing that are not important.
# 3. ( of bird and animal ) to make a series of short high sound.
- Red climbed the tree. He saw the squirrel. It chattered at Red. It said "Leave me alone you crazy cat."

# speaks,   spoke,   spoken,   speaking.
- Red did not speak "squirrel". Red was a cat. He spoke "cat".

# get out ( of something ) to leave or go out of a place.
- "Get out of my tree," the squirrel said.

# ( of animal especially dogs ) to make a low sound in the throat, usually as a sign of anger.
- The dog growled at them. 
- Mama bear growled at the baby bear.

# noun, academic word: a building in which horses are kept.
- Mom took her daughter Carol to the stable. Their horse was in the stable.

#  a solid or hollow figure with six equal square sides.
# Sugar cube ( plural: sugar cubes and British: Sugar lump) a small cube of sugar, used in cups of tea or coffee.
- Mom tool some sugar cubes our of her pocket.
# understands,    understood,    understood,  not used in the progressive tenses.
#  form 85 to 90

# any of a large group of US department stores known for their low price.
- They went into J C Penney.

# to say or do something that make somebody stop what they are saying or doing.
- Do not interrupt me.
- Sorry to interrupt, but there someone to see you.
- They were interrupted by a knock at the door.

# to shut, or to make something shut, with a lot of force, making a loud noise. Synonym: bang.
- I heard the door slam behind him. ( verb )
- The front door closed with a slam. ( noun )
- Do not slam the door.

# ~something, to be spread around a place, making it look untidy.
- Do not litter.
- Piles of books and newspapers littered the floor. 
- The floor was littered with paper.

# not neat or well arranged, it a state of confusing 
- An untidy desk.
- Untidy hair.
# tidy or in order

# arranged neatly and with everything in order.
- A tidy desk.

# drinks,   drank,   drunk,   drinking, 
- He slowly chewed it. Finally, he swallowed it. Then he drank some water.

# leaves,   left,   left,   leaving,
- He left a message for his sister.
- He said he would come to the birthday party.
# why did not he use 'will' here?
# I thing, if it is a about the future and I want to do this, I say: will
# and If it is about the future and someone else ask me to do that I say: would
# but I am not sure about what I said :)

# grows,    grew,   grown,   growing.
- She grew flowers and vegetables in the garden.

# separately or in a group of two, three, etc to each occasion. 
- He was eating the sliced carrots one by one. He was eating them one at a time.
# sometimes.
# Do not you want to see well? Not if I have to see carrots.
Beginning of the week
# From 91 to 96

# a blue, brown or purple mark that appears on the skin often somebody has fallen, been hit, etc.
- Harry punched Scott in the face. Scott went home with a bruise on his face. He had a red bruise on her face.
# a mark on a fruit or vegetable where it is damaged.

# verb ( past and past participle bled, bled ) to lose blood, especially form a weapon or an injury .
- My finger is bleeding.
- Harry fell down, her nose is bleeding.
# bleed somebody day: to take away all somebody's mony.

# 1.past
- Just drive by. Do not stop.
- Excuse me, I cannot get by.
- Time goes by some quickly. 
# 2. in order to visit someone for a short time.
- I will come by this evening and pick up the books.
- Harry fell done. A teacher walked by.

# to start to burn, to make something to start to burn.
- Gas ignites very easily.

# the electrical system of a vehicle that make the fuel begin to burn to start the engine; the place in vehicle when you start this system.
- To turn the ignition off / on.
- To put the key in the ignition.
- Charley put the key into the ignition. Charley turn the key. The car started.

# The wheel that the driver turns to control the directing that a vehicle goes in
- He turned the steering wheel left, then right. Left, right. Left, right.

# a female chicken, often kept for its eggs or meat.
- Do they come form red hens?

# ( also bunk bed ) one of two beds that are attached together, one above the other, especially for children. 
- He had the bottom bunk. His brother has the top bunk.

# { patient } to look something / somebody closely to see if there is anything wrong or to find the cause of problem. 
- The doctor examines her, but could not find nothing wrong. 
- The doctor examined him. The doctor said he was okay.

# hits, hit, hit, hitting. 
- He hit the carpet and woke up.
# wakes, woke, woken, waking.

# a soft part of bed, that you lie on.
- A soft / hood matters

# plural: mattresses. A large plastic or rubber bag that can be filled with air and used as a bed.
- You can sleep on the air mattress.

# 3. to make something read against something else, in a sloping position. 
- Can I lean my bike against the wall?
- They leaned the air mattresses against the wall in the daytime. And put them on the floor at the nighttime.
# From 97 to 102

# a small brown European bird with a red breast.
- A robin is a pretty bird. It has a red breast. It has back wings. It sings a pretty song.

# a large bird, completely black or mostly black, with a rough unpleasant cry.
- A crow is big bird. It is a smart bird. It is a lazy bird.

# A strong desire for more wealth, possession, power, etc than person needs.
# a string desire for more food or drink when you are no longer hungry or thirsty.

# wanted more money, power, food, etc than you are really need.
- You greedy pig! You have already had two helpings.
# helping is a noun: an amount of food given to someone at a meal. Synonym: serving

# at a slow speed. Synonym : slowly.
- Drive slow!
- slow-moving traffic.
- Mrs Jones was old. But she did not walked slow.

# at that moment. 
- Just then, someone knocked on the front door.
- Just then, Kenny's little sister walked into the kitchen.

# very bad or unpleasant, that you do not like it.
- Horrible weather / children / etc
# making you feel very shocked and frightened.  Synonym: terrible
- The beer was horrible. How could daddy drink that stuff?

# ( British: teddy, plural: teddies ) a soft toy bear.
- Last year Sara got a nice gift. She got a teddy bear and rubber duck.

# to place a dead body in a grave. 
# buries,   buried,    buried,    burying.

# to stop living. 
# dies,    died,    died,   dying
- The plants died within a week.

# {on water / in air } to move slowly on water or in the air. Synonym: drift. 
- A group of swans floated by.
# From 103 to 108

# 2 { with somebody }
- We are going for swim, why do not you come along?
- I will be along ( = I will joining you ) in a few minutes.
